title: Set the Equation
text: Let n be the first odd number, and the second consecutive number will be $$n+2$$. The equation will be $$n\left(n+2\right)=1023$$.

title: Solve the Equation
text: Solve $$n\left(n+2\right)=1023$$. You foil out the equation as $$n^2+2n=1023$$. $$n^2+2n-1023=0$$.

title: Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n.
Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n.
text: Apply Quadratic Equation to solve for n when $$n^2+2n-1023=0$$. Enter your answer as (a,b) where $$a<b$$.

title: Find Answer Pairs
text: When the first consecutive number is -33, the second consecutive number is $$-33+2=-31$$. When the first consecutive number is 31, the second consecutive number is $$31+2=33$$. The final answer is (-33,-31),(31,33).
